qas.question: What kingdom was Hellenistic and on the southern coast of the Black Sea?
Who founded the Kingdom of Pontus?
When was the Kingdom of Pontus founded?
When was the Kingdom of Pontus taken over by the Roman Republic?
What was the official language of the Kingdom of Pontus during the reign of Mithridates VI Eupator?

context: The Kingdom of <a0_0>Pontus<a0_0/> was a Hellenistic kingdom on the southern coast of the Black Sea. It was founded by <a1_0>Mithridates I<a1_0/> in <a2_0>291 BC<a2_0/> and lasted until its conquest by the Roman Republic in <a3_0>63 BC<a3_0/>. Despite being ruled by a dynasty which was a descendant of the Persian Achaemenid Empire it became hellenized due to the influence of the Greek cities on the Black Sea and its neighboring kingdoms. Pontic culture was a mix of Greek and Iranian elements, the most hellenized parts of the kingdom were on the coast, populated by Greek colonies such as Trapezus and Sinope, which became the capital of the kingdom. Epigraphic evidence also shows extensive Hellenistic influence in the interior. During the reign of Mithridates II, Pontus was allied with the Seleucids through dynastic marriages. By the time of Mithridates VI Eupator, <a4_0>Greek<a4_0/> was the official language of the kingdom though Anatolian languages continued to be spoken.
